row.Content: Customer relationship management (CRM) functionality provides tools for marketing, sales, and customer support management. In this guide, you will find information about lead qualification workflow, management of marketing lists, marketing campaigns, opportunities, and customer support operations. By using this guide, you can learn how to create and manage leads, qualify leads as performed by marketing and sales teams, create business accounts and contacts associated with leads, manage marketing and sales activities, create and manage opportunities, create sales quotes and invoices associated with opportunities. You can also learn how to manage your company’s customer support service.
row.PlainText: Customer Relationship Management (CRM) Customer relationship management (CRM) functionality provides tools for marketing, sales, and customer support management. In this guide, you will find information about lead qualification workflow, management of marketing lists, marketing campaigns, opportunities, and customer support operations. By using this guide, you can learn how to create and manage leads, qualify leads as performed by marketing and sales teams, create business accounts and contacts associated with leads, manage marketing and sales activities, create and manage opportunities, create sales quotes and invoices associated with opportunities. You can also learn how to manage your company's customer support service.

row.column: CRM: General Information Customer relationship management (CRM) functionality helps companies manage their interaction with current and potential customers to identify and address effectively their target audience’s needs and build a strong relationship with the customers. Acumatica ERP provides tools for process automation, data management, and reporting for marketing, sales and customer support teams. You can easily customize the CRM functionality to fit your company’s business goals, streamline your marketing, sales, and customer support processes, and ensure higher profitability. Overview of Marketing Processes Marketing functionality in Acumatica ERP helps marketing teams acquire, manage, and qualify leads, handle marketing lists and marketing subscriptions, manage marketing campaigns, and generate marketing reports. Processing leads by marketing personnel may consist of the following stages: Creating leads. For details, see Creating Leads. Validating leads for duplicates. For details, see Validating Records for Duplicates. Assigning leads to owners. For details, see Assigning Leads To Owners. Managing leads. For details, see Managing Emails and Activities. Managing marketing lists. For details, see Managing Marketing Lists. Managing marketing campaigns. For details, see Managing Marketing Campaigns. Qualifying leads. For details, see Qualifying Leads (Marketing). Analyzing marketing results and performance of a marketing team by generating reports. For details, see Managing CRM Reports. Overview of Sales Processes Sales functionality in Acumatica ERP helps sales teams manage and qualify leads, create contacts and business accounts for prospects, create, manage and advance opportunities through stages, manage opportunity-based quotes, sales orders, and invoices, and generate sales reports. Processing leads and customers by sales personnel may consist of the following stages: Assigning leads to owners. For details, see Assigning Leads To Owners. Managing leads. For details, see Managing Emails and Activities. Validating contacts and accounts for duplicates. For details, see Validating Records for Duplicates. Creating contacts. For details, see Creating Contacts. Creating business accounts. For details, see Creating Business Accounts. Managing opportunities. For details, see Managing Opportunities. Analyzing sales results and performance of a sales team by generating reports. For details, see Managing CRM Reports. Overview of Customer Support Processes Customer support functionality in Acumatica ERP gives you the ability to track support cases (tickets) through to resolution. The communication with your customer can begin when a customer creates a new case on the Acumatica Self-Service Portal, sends an email, or makes a phone call to your customer support service. Service and support activities are integrated with other functional area in Acumatica ERP —such as sales, marketing, field services, and financials—to deliver a team-oriented approach to customer support and increased sales. You can automate escalations as assignment of cases that come in to your organization. Processing cases by customer support personnel may consist of the following stages: Creating support cases. For details, see Managing Cases. Assigning cases to owners. For details, see Case Assignment. Processing cases. For details, see Case Processing. Creating a service order for the service dispatcher. For details, see Processing Service Orders. Creating and appointment for the service technician. For details, see Processing Appointments. Releasing cases ans creating the associated invoices. For details, see Case Billing. Analyzing results and performance of customer. For details, see Managing CRM Reports.

Creating Leads: General Information The processing of leads in Acumatica ERP starts with adding leads to the system. This topic provides information about lead creation in Acumatica ERP. Learning Objectives In this chapter, you will learn how to do the following: Create a lead manually Import leads from a purchased list Create a lead by using the Acumatica add-in for Outlook Applicable Scenarios You may want to learn how to register leads in Acumatica ERP in scenarios that include the following: You have obtained some contact information about a potential customer. You have acquired a list of cold leads (individuals or organizations who never contacted your organization or expressed any interest in your products or services) from a vendor or a public source. You have started working with the system and need to import your existing leads from your legacy system into Acumatica ERP. You have received an email from a potential customer. Marketing Leads in Acumatica ERPA marketing lead is contact information representing a person or a company that has a potential interest in products or services your organization offers. Leads make up the organization’s marketing audience, which is the target for marketing activities, such as marketing campaigns or advertisements. A marketing manager defines the organization’s marketing strategy, goals, and target audience, as well as acquiring and managing data on the marketing audience. When the audience data has been acquired, the marketing manager can create the needed leads in the system. Lead Creation Lead creation in Acumatica ERP consists of either or both of the following general steps: Creating leads manually Importing lead data from external sources As soon as leads have been added to the system and checked for duplicates, as described in Validating Records for Duplicates, you can assign these leads to owners either one by one or in batches according to the rules that have been specified in the system, and the owners start working on these leads, as described in Assigning Leads To Owners. In Acumatica ERP, you can create a lead in any of the following ways: By manually entering lead data on the ([~/?ScreenId=CR301000|CR301000]) Leads (CR301000) form. For detailed instructions, see Creating Leads: To Create a Lead Manually. On the ([~/?ScreenId=CR302000|CR302000]) Contacts (CR302000) or ([~/?ScreenId=CR303000|CR303000]) Business Accounts (CR303000) form, if you click Actions Create Lead . By using import scenarios to import lists of leads on the ([~/?ScreenId=SM206036|SM206036]) Import by Scenario (SM206036) form. For detailed instructions, see Creating Leads: To Import Leads From a Purchased List. By creating a lead from the Acumatica add-in for Outlook based on the details of the selected email recipient or sender. For detailed instructions, see ([~/?ScreenId=OU000000|OU000000]) Acumatica Add-In for Outlook and To Create a Lead by Using the Acumatica Add-In. By enabling integration with web services on the ([~/?ScreenId=SM207040|SM207040]) Web Services (SM207040) form for the automatic import of leads. For details, see Web Service Endpoints. By using the integration with HubSpot. For details, see Configuring Integration with HubSpot. By activating the functionality of incoming mail processing on the ([~/?ScreenId=SM204002|SM204002]) System Email Accounts (SM204002) form for the automatic creation of leads based on information about the sender. For details, see Incoming Mail Processing. Contact Information On the Contact Info tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=CR301000|CR301000]) Leads (CR301000) form, you can specify the name, contact information, and address of the selected lead. Also, this tab holds information about the lead's consent to the processing of personal data if the GDPR Compliance Tools feature is enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form. (For details about GDPR compliance tools, see Handling Personal Data.) If the Override check box on the Contact Info tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=CR301000|CR301000]) Leads form is cleared, the contact information of the selected lead is synchronized with the contact information of the related contact and business account on the ([~/?ScreenId=CR302000|CR302000]) Contacts (CR302000) form and the ([~/?ScreenId=CR303000|CR303000]) Business Accounts (CR303000) form, respectively. If the check box is selected, the contact information for the selected lead on the ([~/?ScreenId=CR301000|CR301000]) Leads form can differ from the contact information of the related record on the ([~/?ScreenId=CR302000|CR302000]) Contacts and ([~/?ScreenId=CR303000|CR303000]) Business Accounts forms, as well as from the contact information of the leads related to this lead. The synchronization or overriding of settings applies to all the settings on the Contact Info tab. Synchronization of Settings in Leads, Contacts, and Business Accounts In Acumatica ERP, you can easily synchronize the contact-related settings of a lead with the same settings in the contact and business account related to that lead. With this synchronization turned on, changes to the contact information of any of these entities causes the settings in the related entities to be updated as well. The synchronization or overriding of settings applies to all the settings on the Contact Info tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=CR301000|CR301000]) Leads (CR301000) form, all the settings on the Details tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=CR302000|CR302000]) Contacts (CR302000) form, and the contact and address settings (of the primary contact of the business account) on the General tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=CR303000|CR303000]) Business Accounts (CR303000) form. You can synchronize contact information in leads, contacts, and business accounts by using the Override check box on the Contact Info tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=CR302000|CR302000]) Contacts (CR302000) form as follows: If the check box is cleared and the business account related to the contact has not been converted to a customer or a vendor yet, the contact information of the contact on the ([~/?ScreenId=CR302000|CR302000]) Contacts form is synchronized with the contact information of the related lead and business account on the ([~/?ScreenId=CR301000|CR301000]) Leads and ([~/?ScreenId=CR303000|CR303000]) Business Accounts forms, respectively, and can be updated in both directions. That is, if you update the contact and address settings on any of these forms, the settings will be also updated on the related forms. If the check box is selected, the contact information for the selected contact on the ([~/?ScreenId=CR302000|CR302000]) Contacts form can differ from the contact information of the related lead and business account on the ([~/?ScreenId=CR301000|CR301000]) Leads and ([~/?ScreenId=CR303000|CR303000]) Business Accounts forms. If contact information is updated on any of these forms, the changes are not related on the other forms. Flexible Classification of Leads In Acumatica ERP, you can easily categorize leads into different classes and gather different sets of additional information about leads of different classes. When you create a new lead, the system can automatically assign a class to this lead and you can change the class as needed. For each class, you can create a set of attributes, which give users the ability to further classify leads within the class. For each attribute, you can define the type of control that represents it in the UI (check box, text box, or combo box) and specify the possible values, if applicable. For details, see Configuring Classes in CRM. When a class for a lead has been selected, the attributes assigned to this class appear on the Attributes tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=CR301000|CR301000]) Leads (CR301000) form as additional elements that can be used to specify information about a lead. An administrator can customize the ([~/?ScreenId=CR301000|CR301000]) Leads (CR301000) form to add to the Summary area the User-Defined Fields tab that holds the attributes. By using these fields, you can easily specify the attributes for the leads you are working with.

Before you start creating leads in Acumatica ERP, you must be sure that the system has been configured properly and that all required entities have been created, as described in the following sections. ==Enabling the Needed Features== On the [HelpRoot_FormReference\CS_10_00_00|Enable/Disable Features] ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) form, the following features must be enabled:[anchor|#_9deb770a-599e-4cd9-be8e-4a1f97b9e4ec] *''Customer Management'': Provides the customer relationship management (CRM) functionality, including lead and customer tracking, as well as handling of sales opportunities, contacts, marketing lists, and campaigns. *''Outlook Integration'' (in the ''Customer Management'' group of features): Gives you the ability to log your activities, create opportunities, and create leads and contacts by using your Microsoft Outlook account.
==Configuring the System== Before you start creating leads in Acumatica ERP, you need to make sure that the following tasks have been performed:[anchor|#_fac6f718-1107-4cdc-9f53-57b5d3402354] *On the [HelpRoot_FormReference\CR_10_10_00|Customer Management Preferences] form, all necessary settings have been specified and saved to the system. *If you will be importing leads, on the [HelpRoot_FormReference\SM_20_60_25|Import Scenarios] ([~/?ScreenId=SM206025|SM206025]) form, an import scenario has been configured. You can use import scenarios to import a list of leads from a Microsoft Excel file. For more information about import scenarios, see [HelpRoot_Integration\IS__mng_Configuring_Import_Scenarios|Configuring Import Scenarios]. *Optional: The needed classes with the necessary details and attributes have been created on the [HelpRoot_FormReference\CR_20_70_00|Lead Classes] ([~/?ScreenId=CR207000|CR207000]) form. *Optional: In the Summary area of the [HelpRoot_FormReference\CR_30_10_00|Leads] ([~/?ScreenId=CR301000|CR301000]) form, the '''User-Defined Fields''' tab, which holds the values of attributes, has been added.

Creating Leads: Configuration Prerequisites Before you start creating leads in Acumatica ERP, you must be sure that the system has been configured properly and that all required entities have been created, as described in the following sections. Enabling the Needed Features On the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form, the following features must be enabled: Customer Management : Provides the customer relationship management (CRM) functionality, including lead and customer tracking , as well as handling of sales opportunities, contacts, marketing lists, and campaigns. Outlook Integration (in the Customer Management group of features): Gives you the ability to log your activities, create opportunities, and create leads and contacts by using your Microsoft Outlook account. Configuring the System Before you start creating leads in Acumatica ERP, you need to make sure that the following tasks have been performed: On the ([~/?ScreenId=CR101000|CR101000]) Customer Management Preferences form, all necessary settings have been specified and saved to the system. If you will be importing leads, on the ([~/?ScreenId=SM206025|SM206025]) Import Scenarios (SM206025) form, an import scenario has been configured. You can use import scenarios to import a list of leads from a Microsoft Excel file. For more information about import scenarios, see Configuring Import Scenarios. Optional: The needed classes with the necessary details and attributes have been created on the ([~/?ScreenId=CR207000|CR207000]) Lead Classes (CR207000) form. Optional: In the Summary area of the ([~/?ScreenId=CR301000|CR301000]) Leads (CR301000) form, the User-Defined Fields tab, which holds the values of attributes, has been added.

The following activity demonstrates how to create a lead manually in Acumatica ERP.[anchor|#_77a9beb6-ef72-4b27-97d2-df7321ded10f]((({S:Danger}The following activity is based on the ''U100'' dataset. If you are using another dataset, or if any system settings have been changed in ''U100'', these changes can affect the workflow of the activity and the results of the processing. To avoid any issues, restore the ''U100'' dataset to its initial state. ))) ==Story== Suppose that you are Bill Owen, a marketing manager of the SweetLife Fruits & Jams company. You have received a call from Sam Collins, the bakery manager of Muffin Secret, a bakery that cooks pastries, usually with jam filling. Sam would like to purchase 50 jars each of apple, orange, and cherry jam and wonders what discount he can obtain from the SweetLife if he chooses to buy the jams. ==Configuration Overview== In the ''U100'' dataset, for the purposes of this activity, the following tasks have been performed:[anchor|#_60133d22-8f97-414c-bd9f-a74a0683ee9b] *On the [HelpRoot_FormReference\CS_10_00_00|Enable/Disable Features] ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) form, the ''Customer Management'' feature has been enabled. *On the [HelpRoot_FormReference\CR_20_70_00|Lead Classes] ([~/?ScreenId=CR207000|CR207000]) form, the ''BAKERY'' class, which defines SweetLife’s leads that represent bakery employees, has been created. *On the [HelpRoot_FormReference\CR_10_10_00|Customer Management Preferences] form, in the '''Default Lead Class''' box, the ''BAKERY'' class has been specified. *Optional: On the [HelpRoot_FormReference\CR_30_10_00|Leads] ([~/?ScreenId=CR301000|CR301000]) form, the '''User-Defined Fields''' tab, which holds the values of attributes, has been added, and the '''Interested in''' box has been added to the tab.
==Process Overview== In this activity, you will create a lead on the [HelpRoot_FormReference\CR_30_10_00|Leads] ([~/?ScreenId=CR301000|CR301000]) form. ==System Preparation== Before you start creating leads manually, you should do the following:[anchor|#_49408a70-7c4a-4268-a217-e2acaf2bf475] #Launch the Acumatica ERP website, and sign in as a marketing manager Bill Owen by using the following credentials: #*Username: ''owen'' #*Password: ''123'' #Make sure that on the Company and Branch Selection menu, in the top pane of the Acumatica ERP screen, the ''SweetLife Head Office and Wholesale Center'' branch is selected.
==Step: Creating a Lead Manually== To create a lead manually, do the following:[anchor|#_fa742785-635f-4638-890f-918dff014a89] #Open the the Leads (CR3010PL) form.[anchor|#_105c2501-bb70-4758-ab3c-dd04d591f0b1] #On the form toolbar, click '''New Record'''. #In the Summary area of the [HelpRoot_FormReference\CR_30_10_00|Leads] ([~/?ScreenId=CR301000|CR301000]) form, which opens, do the following: ##In the '''Description''' box, add : <tt>The bakery manager submitted an inquiry on the corporate website about a discount for 100 jars of apple, orange, and cherry jam</tt>. ##In the '''Source''' box, select ''Other''. #On the '''Contact Info''' tab, specify the following contact information for the lead: ##'''First Name''': <tt>Sam</tt> ##'''Last Name''': <tt>Collins</tt> ##'''Company Name''': <tt>Muffin Secret</tt> ##'''Job Title''': <tt>Bakery Manager</tt> ##'''Email''': <tt>s.collins@muffin.secret.example.com</tt> ##'''Business 1''': <tt>+1 (212) 509-6005</tt> ##'''Address Line 1''': <tt>2359 Southern Street</tt> ##'''City''': <tt>New York</tt> ##'''Country''': <tt>United States of America</tt> #On the '''CRM Info''' tab, in the '''Lead Class''' box, make sure that the ''BAKERY'' class has been specified. #Optional: In the '''User-Defined Fields''' tab of the Summary area, in the '''Interested in''' box, select ''Jam''. #On the form toolbar, click '''Save'''.
You have created the lead in the system. In the Summary area of the [HelpRoot_FormReference\CR_30_10_00|Leads] form, you can see ''Sam Collins'' in the '''Lead ID''' box and ''New'' in the '''Status''' box.

Creating Leads: To Create a Lead Manually The following activity demonstrates how to create a lead manually in Acumatica ERP. The following activity is based on the U100 dataset. If you are using another dataset, or if any system settings have been changed in U100 , these changes can affect the workflow of the activity and the results of the processing. To avoid any issues, restore the U100 dataset to its initial state. Story Suppose that you are Bill Owen, a marketing manager of the SweetLife Fruits & Jams company. You have received a call from Sam Collins, the bakery manager of Muffin Secret, a bakery that cooks pastries, usually with jam filling. Sam would like to purchase 50 jars each of apple, orange, and cherry jam and wonders what discount he can obtain from the SweetLife if he chooses to buy the jams. Configuration Overview In the U100 dataset , for the purposes of this activity, the following tasks have been performed: On the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form, the Customer Management feature has been enabled. On the ([~/?ScreenId=CR207000|CR207000]) Lead Classes (CR207000) form, the BAKERY class, which defines SweetLife's leads that represent bakery employees, has been created. On the ([~/?ScreenId=CR101000|CR101000]) Customer Management Preferences form, in the Default Lead Class box, the BAKERY class has been specified. Optional: On the ([~/?ScreenId=CR301000|CR301000]) Leads (CR301000) form, the User-Defined Fields tab, which holds the values of attributes, has been added, and the Interested in box has been added to the tab. Process Overview In this activity, you will create a lead on the ([~/?ScreenId=CR301000|CR301000]) Leads (CR301000) form. System Preparation Before you start creating leads manually, you should do the following: Launch the Acumatica ERP website, and sign in as a marketing manager Bill Owen by using the following credentials: Username: owen Password: 123 Make sure that on the Company and Branch Selection menu, in the top pane of the Acumatica ERP screen, the SweetLife Head Office and Wholesale Center branch is selected. Step: Creating a Lead Manually To create a lead manually, do the following: Open the the Leads (CR3010PL) form. On the form toolbar, click New Record . In the Summary area of the ([~/?ScreenId=CR301000|CR301000]) Leads (CR301000) form, which opens, do the following: In the Description box, add : The bakery manager submitted an inquiry on the corporate website about a discount for 100 jars of apple, orange, and cherry jam . In the Source box, select Other . On the Contact Info tab, specify the following contact information for the lead: First Name : Sam Last Name : Collins Company Name : Muffin Secret Job Title : Bakery Manager Email : s.collins@muffin.secret.example.com Business 1 : +1 (212) 509-6005 Address Line 1 : 2359 Southern Street City : New York Country : United States of America On the CRM Info tab, in the Lead Class box, make sure that the BAKERY class has been specified. Optional : In the User-Defined Fields tab of the Summary area, in the Interested in box, select Jam . On the form toolbar, click Save . You have created the lead in the system. In the Summary area of the ([~/?ScreenId=CR301000|CR301000]) Leads form, you can see Sam Collins in the Lead ID box and New in the Status box.

The following activity demonstrates how to import a purchased list of leads to Acumatica ERP by using an import scenario.[anchor|#_075c4c3e-5c35-4a4f-bb8d-fad2c05d3aa3]((({S:Danger}The following activity is based on the ''U100'' dataset. If you are using another dataset, or if any system settings have been changed in ''U100'', these changes can affect the workflow of the activity and the results of the processing. To avoid any issues, restore the ''U100'' dataset to its initial state. ))) ==Story== Suppose that you are Bill Owen, a marketing manager of the SweetLife Fruits & Jams company. SweetLife uses purchased lists as sources of leads. The lists are imported into Acumatica ERP so that all records are stored in a single place, managed, and classified. You have acquired a new purchased list, <tt>PurchasedLeads.xlsx</tt>, which has the contact information of bakery and restaurant employees. You need to import these leads from the Microsoft Excel file to Acumatica ERP. ==Configuration Overview== For the purposes of this activity, the following tasks have been performed:[anchor|#_d05b3823-d782-40ea-b8d8-a1fe43ff8ba8] *On the [HelpRoot_FormReference\CS_10_00_00|Enable/Disable Features] ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) form, the ''Customer Management'' feature has been enabled. *On the [HelpRoot_FormReference\CR_20_70_00|Lead Classes] ([~/?ScreenId=CR207000|CR207000]) form, the ''STORE'' lead class has been added. *On the [HelpRoot_FormReference\SM_20_60_15|Data Providers] ([~/?ScreenId=SM206015|SM206015]) form, the ''Lead Import from Purchased List'' data provider has been added and configured. *On the [HelpRoot_FormReference\SM_20_60_25|Import Scenarios] ([~/?ScreenId=SM206025|SM206025]) form, the ''Import Leads from Purchased List'' import scenario has been configured. This scenario can be used for the import of leads from a Microsoft Excel file to Acumatica ERP. The ''Lead Import from Purchased List'' data provider is used for this import scenario. The imported leads will belong to the ''STORE'' lead class. For details, see [HelpRoot_Integration\IS__mng_Configuring_Import_Scenarios|Configuring Import Scenarios].
==Process Overview== On the [HelpRoot_FormReference\SM_20_60_36|Import by Scenario] ([~/?ScreenId=SM206036|SM206036]) form, you will select the ''Import Leads from Purchased List'' import scenario and then upload to the system the Microsoft Excel file with the purchased list of leads. After that, you will prepare the data so that the system validates the rows of records, and then you will initiate the import process. ==System Preparation== Before you start importing leads from a purchased list to Acumatica ERP, do the following:[anchor|#_89e97719-b17b-4b85-82cf-6191bc681554] #Launch the Acumatica ERP website, and sign in as a marketing manager with the following credentials: #*Username: ''owen'' #*Password: ''123'' #Make sure that the business date in your system is set to 1/30/2020. If a different date is displayed, in the top pane of the Acumatica ERP screen, click the Business Date menu button, and select 1/30/2020 from the calendar. A past date is used in this activity so that if you run any of the reports noted in <link to the lesson that describe reports>, you can examine leads created during a particular time. #Download the file <tt>PurchasedLeads.xlsx</tt> to your computer.
==Step: Importing Leads From a Purchased List== To import leads from the purchased list in the <tt>PurchasedLeads.xlsx</tt> file, do the following:[anchor|#ol_jh4_4dm_34] #Open the [HelpRoot_FormReference\SM_20_60_36|Import by Scenario] ([~/?ScreenId=SM206036|SM206036]) form. #In the '''Name''' box of the Summary area, select ''Import Leads from Purchased List''. #On the form title bar, click '''Files'''. #In the '''Files''' dialog box, which opens, do the following: ##Click '''Browse'''. ##In the window that opens, find the <tt>PurchasedLeads.xlsx</tt> file. ##Click '''Upload'''. The information about the uploaded file is displayed in the table of the '''Files''' dialog box. ##Close the '''Files''' dialog box. #On the form toolbar, click '''Prepare'''.The table on the '''Prepared Data''' tab becomes populated with the data from the uploaded file, with each row corresponding to a lead. In the Summary area of the form, notice that the '''Number of Records''' box contains ''22'', which represents the number of leads that have been prepared to be imported in the system. #On the form toolbar, click '''Import''' to initiate the import of the selected records. A green check mark appears on the form toolbar when the process has completed successfully. Notice that in the table, for the imported records, the check boxes in the '''Processed''' column are selected.
You have imported to the system leads from the purchased list in the <tt>PurchasedLeads.xlsx</tt> file. On the [HelpRoot_FormReference\CR_30_10_00|Leads] ([~/?ScreenId=CR301000|CR301000]) form, you can see all newly imported leads.

Creating Leads: To Import Leads From a Purchased List The following activity demonstrates how to import a purchased list of leads to Acumatica ERP by using an import scenario. The following activity is based on the U100 dataset. If you are using another dataset, or if any system settings have been changed in U100 , these changes can affect the workflow of the activity and the results of the processing. To avoid any issues, restore the U100 dataset to its initial state. Story Suppose that you are Bill Owen, a marketing manager of the SweetLife Fruits & Jams company. SweetLife uses purchased lists as sources of leads. The lists are imported into Acumatica ERP so that all records are stored in a single place, managed, and classified. You have acquired a new purchased list, PurchasedLeads.xlsx , which has the contact information of bakery and restaurant employees. You need to import these leads from the Microsoft Excel file to Acumatica ERP. Configuration Overview For the purposes of this activity, the following tasks have been performed: On the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features (CS101000) form, the Customer Management feature has been enabled. On the ([~/?ScreenId=CR207000|CR207000]) Lead Classes (CR207000) form, the STORE lead class has been added. On the ([~/?ScreenId=SM206015|SM206015]) Data Providers (SM206015) form, the Lead Import from Purchased List data provider has been added and configured. On the ([~/?ScreenId=SM206025|SM206025]) Import Scenarios (SM206025) form, the Import Leads from Purchased List import scenario has been configured. This scenario can be used for the import of leads from a Microsoft Excel file to Acumatica ERP. The Lead Import from Purchased List data provider is used for this import scenario. The imported leads will belong to the STORE lead class. For details, see Configuring Import Scenarios. Process Overview On the ([~/?ScreenId=SM206036|SM206036]) Import by Scenario (SM206036) form, you will select the Import Leads from Purchased List import scenario and then upload to the system the Microsoft Excel file with the purchased list of leads. After that, you will prepare the data so that the system validates the rows of records, and then you will initiate the import process. System Preparation Before you start importing leads from a purchased list to Acumatica ERP, do the following: Launch the Acumatica ERP website, and sign in as a marketing manager with the following credentials: Username: owen Password: 123 Make sure that the business date in your system is set to 1/30/2020. If a different date is displayed, in the top pane of the Acumatica ERP screen, click the Business Date menu button, and select 1/30/2020 from the calendar. A past date is used in this activity so that if you run any of the reports noted in <link to the lesson that describe reports>, you can examine leads created during a particular time . Download the file PurchasedLeads.xlsx to your computer. Step: Importing Leads From a Purchased List To import leads from the purchased list in the PurchasedLeads.xlsx file, do the following: Open the ([~/?ScreenId=SM206036|SM206036]) Import by Scenario (SM206036) form. In the Name box of the Summary area, select Import Leads from Purchased List . On the form title bar, click Files . In the Files dialog box, which opens, do the following: Click Browse . In the window that opens, find the PurchasedLeads.xlsx file. Click Upload . The information about the uploaded file is displayed in the table of the Files dialog box. Close the Files dialog box. On the form toolbar, click Prepare .The table on the Prepared Data tab becomes populated with the data from the uploaded file, with each row corresponding to a lead. In the Summary area of the form, notice that the Number of Records box contains 22 , which represents the number of leads that have been prepared to be imported in the system. On the form toolbar, click Import to initiate the import of the selected records. A green check mark appears on the form toolbar when the process has completed successfully. Notice that in the table, for the imported records, the check boxes in the Processed column are selected. You have imported to the system leads from the purchased list in the PurchasedLeads.xlsx file. On the ([~/?ScreenId=CR301000|CR301000]) Leads (CR301000) form, you can see all newly imported leads.

Bill receives an email from Stephanie Andrews, a supplies buyer at Muffin Secret bakery. In the email, Stephanie requests for the detailed price list of the SweetLife Fruits & Jams. Bill needs to register the lead in the system for further communication. Configuration Overview For the purposes of this activity, the following features have been enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form. Customer Management Outlook Integration in the Customer Management group of features The Acumatica add-in for Outlook should be installed for your Microsoft Outlook application. For details, see ([~/?ScreenId=OU000000|OU000000]) Acumatica Add-In for Outlook. Process Overview In this activity, you will create a new lead in the system by using the Acumatica add-in for Outlook and quickly edit the lead's contact information on the ([~/?ScreenId=CR301000|CR301000]) Leads (CR301000) form. In This Chapter Validating Records for Duplicates: General InformationValidating Records for Duplicates: Implementation ChecklistValidating Records for Duplicates: To Validate a Lead for DuplicatesValidating Records for Duplicates: To Validate Multiple Leads for Duplicates
row.column: In this chapter, you will find information about validating leads, contacts, and business accounts for duplicates. ==In This Chapter== *[HelpRoot_CRM\CRM_Mktg_Validating_Recs_Duplicates_GeneralInfo|Validating Records for Duplicates: General Information] *:Duplicate records in your marketing data may cause data quality problems that result in lost productivity for your marketing and sales teams. A large number of duplicate leads, contacts, and business accounts could trigger the sending of the same marketing materials multiple times to the same contact or business account. The probability of duplicates significantly increases each time that you add to the system a large batch of new records. *[HelpRoot_CRM\CRM_Mktg_Validating_Recs_Duplicates_Implem_Checklist|Validating Records for Duplicates: Implementation Checklist] *:The following sections provide details you can use to ensure that the system is configured properly for validating lead, contact, and business account records for duplicates. This information will also help you understand (and change, if needed) the settings that affect the workflow of validating duplicate records. *[HelpRoot_CRM\CRM_Mktg_Validating_Recs_Duplicates_Validating_Lead|Validating Records for Duplicates: To Validate a Lead for Duplicates] *:Before you start working with a lead (or another employee does so), you may want to make sure that the lead has no duplicate leads in the system. The following activity will show you how to validate a lead for duplicates. *[HelpRoot_CRM\CRM_Mktg_Validating_Recs_Duplicates_Validate_Multiple_Leads|Validating Records for Duplicates: To Validate Multiple Leads for Duplicates] *:The following activity demonstrates how to validate records—such as leads, contacts, and business accounts—for duplicates.

Validating Records for Duplicates: General Information Duplicate records in your marketing data may cause data quality problems that result in lost productivity for your marketing and sales teams. A large number of duplicate leads, contacts, and business accounts could trigger the sending of the same marketing materials multiple times to the same contact or business account. The probability of duplicates significantly increases each time that you add to the system a large batch of new records. To address these issues, Acumatica ERP provides flexible tools for eliminating duplicate records. Learning Objectives In this chapter, you will learn how to do the following: Validate leads and contacts for duplicates Merge duplicate leads Link leads and contacts Applicable Scenarios You may want to learn how to validate records for duplicates in Acumatica ERP in either (or both) of the following cases: You have imported to the system a batch of new leads and need to check these leads for duplicates. You regularly validate all records in the system for duplicates, and it is time to again initiate this process. Duplicate Validation in Acumatica ERPWhen a new lead, contact, or business account is created in the system, Acumatica ERP can check the newly created record for duplicates on entry (when the record is saved for the first time) or at the request of the user. Records can be validated for duplicates if the following setup tasks have been performed in the system: The Lead/Contact Duplicate Validation feature is enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form. Default duplicate validation rules have been defined for each type of records (leads, contacts, and business accounts) on the Duplicate Validation Settings tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=CR101000|CR101000]) Customer Management Preferences (CR101000) form. For more details, see Duplicate Validation Rules for Leads, Contacts, and Business Accounts Duplicate Validation Rules for Leads, Contacts, and Business Accounts. Additional duplicate validation settings should also be specified on the ([~/?ScreenId=CR101000|CR101000]) Customer Management Preferences form. For more details, see Additional Duplicate Validation Settings Additional Duplicate Validation Settings. The calculation of grams, which are used for the calculation of validation scores, has been performed for each contact, lead, or business account record on the ([~/?ScreenId=CR503400|CR503400]) Calculate Grams (CR503400) form. For more details, see Calculation of Validation Scores Calculation of Validation Scores. After the setup tasks have been performed, users can validate records for duplicates, as described in Validation of Records for Duplicates Validation of Records for Duplicates. They can merge duplicate records into one record, which involves updating the information in the target record and closing the duplicate record. (For details, see Merging of Records on the Duplicates Tab Merging of Records on the Duplicates Tab.) Optionally, users can link the related leads, contacts, and business accounts, as described in Linking of Records on the Duplicates Tab Linking of Records on the Duplicates Tab. As a result, the leads, contacts, and business accounts in the system are free of duplication, which improves productivity for the personnel, who can now work with consistent and reliable data. Duplicate Validation Rules for Leads, Contacts, and Business Accounts Lead, contact, and business account records have the same internal fields (and corresponding UI elements), which contain the contact and address settings of a person or company. By using the settings on the Duplicate Validation Settings tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=CR101000|CR101000]) Customer Management Preferences (CR101000) form, you can specify your organization’s rules for duplicate validation. You can select the fields according to your criteria; for example, you can compare only email addresses or compare multiple settings, such as email addresses, last names, and company names. You determine how the duplicate validation process is performed by using the Duplicate Validation Settings tab. The lower part of this tab contains three tabs, where you specify various duplication validation rules. During the duplication validation process, the system does the following: Validates leads against other leads, contacts, and business accounts according to the rules specified on the Lead and Contact Validation Rules tab. Validates contacts against other contacts and leads based on the rules specified on the Lead and Contact Validation Rules tab. Validates leads against business accounts using the rules specified on the Lead and Account Validation Rules tab. Validates business accounts against other business accounts based on the rules specified on the Account Validation Rules tab. Consider the example of the lead and contact validation rules shown in the following screenshot. Example of duplicate validation rules for leads and contacts You can use the following elements on the tab (which correspond to the items labeled in the screenshot): Lead and Contact Validation Rules tab: Here you can specify settings (matching fields, score weights, and transformation rules) for lead and contact validation. Matching Field column: In this column, you can specify each field whose values the system will compare during the validation process. Score Weight column: The score weight you specify here indicates the share that the field contributes to the total validation score if two values match. The total validation score of a pair of compared records is calculated as the sum of the weights of the fields whose values match. By using the rules specified in the example shown in the screenshot, if email addresses match, the weight of 1.5 is added, and if both email addresses and last names match, the weight of 3.5 is added. Transformation Rule column: For each listed field, this column contains one of the following options, which indicate the rule the system will use to transform the matching field values before comparing them: None : No additional rules are applied; the whole values are compared as they are. Split Words : The system will compare separate words that make up the two values. Domain Name : The system will compare the applicable domain name, such as domain.com . In an email address or a URL (the Web field), the system will use the domain part of the address. For example, if the email address is email@example.com , then only example.com will be used for comparison. Lead and Contact Validation Threshold box (Summary area of the tab): Here you can specify the threshold value used to determine whether the compared records are possible duplicates. The total score of the fields listed in the Score Weight column should be greater than or the same as the value in the Lead and Contact Validation Threshold box. With the settings shown in the screenshot above, during lead and contact duplicate validation, the system compares all the values in the Score Weight column, adds the validation scores for the values that match, and then compares the total validation score against the threshold specified in the Lead and Contact Validation Threshold box. If the total validation score equals or exceeds this threshold value, the compared records are considered possible duplicates. Additional Duplicate Validation Settings On the Duplicate Validation Settings tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=CR101000|CR101000]) Customer Management Preferences (CR101000) form, you can specify additional duplicate validation settings to do the following: Validate a lead or contact for duplicates on entry: If you select the Validate Leads and Contacts for Duplicates on Entry check box, the system will validate each new lead or contact as soon as a user creates the record on the ([~/?ScreenId=CR301000|CR301000]) Leads (CR301000) or ([~/?ScreenId=CR302000|CR302000]) Contacts (CR302000) form and saves the record for the first time. As a result of validation, the record is given the duplicate status of either Validated or Possible Duplicate : The system inserts one of these values in the Duplicate box of the Summary area. Validate a business account for duplicates on entry: If you select the Validate Accounts for Duplicates on Entry check box, the system will validate each new business account as soon as a user creates the account on the ([~/?ScreenId=CR303000|CR303000]) Business Accounts (CR303000) form and saves the record for the first time. As a result of validation, the business account is given the duplicate status of either Validated or Possible Duplicate : The system inserts one of these values in the Duplicate box of the Summary area. Validate a lead or contact for duplicates base on the email address of the lead or contact: If you select the Require Unique Email Address on Contact Validation check box, the system will validate each new lead or contact email address for duplication as soon as a user specifies the email address on the ([~/?ScreenId=CR301000|CR301000]) Leads or ([~/?ScreenId=CR302000|CR302000]) Contacts form and saves the record for the first time. As a result of validation, the record is given the duplicate status of either Validated or Possible Duplicate : The system inserts one of these values in the Duplicate box of the Summary area. Calculation of Validation Scores In Acumatica ERP, grams are used for the calculation of validation scores for each lead, contact, or business account. Each record has a number of settings, such as Last Name , Email , or Class ID . The grams value assigned to a particular record is defined by the total number of settings that are involved in the calculation of the validation score. As a rule, validation scores are calculated automatically if the Lead/Contact Duplicate Validation feature is enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form. You need to recalculate validation scores on the ([~/?ScreenId=CR503400|CR503400]) Calculate Grams (CR503400) form in the following cases: The ([~/?ScreenId=CR503400|CR503400]) Calculate Grams form is available only if the Lead/Contact Duplicate Validation feature is enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form. Validation rules have been changed on the Duplicate Validation Settings tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=CR101000|CR101000]) Customer Management Preferences (CR101000) form. The Lead/Contact Duplicate Validation feature was temporarily disabled while a batch of new records was imported into Acumatica ERP and then was enabled again. Validation of Records for Duplicates Acumatica ERP provides the ability to mass-validate groups of records for duplicates and to validate individual records. To mass-validate records, you can use the ([~/?ScreenId=CR503410|CR503410]) Validate Leads and Contacts (CR503410) and ([~/?ScreenId=CR503420|CR503420]) Validate Accounts (CR503420) forms. On these forms, you can validate either records with the Not Validated duplicate status or all listed records. Validating all the records in the system may be a time-consuming process if you are validating a very large number of records. You can speed up duplicate validation by using parallel processing. For details, see Validating Records for Duplicates. If you validate all records, once you click Process All on the form toolbar, the system starts processing records one by one, first changing the duplicate status of each record to Not Validated in the Duplicate box of the Summary area on the ([~/?ScreenId=CR301000|CR301000]) Leads (CR301000) form for a lead and the ([~/?ScreenId=CR302000|CR302000]) Contacts (CR302000) form for each contact. As a result of validation, each record is given a duplicate status of either Validated or Possible Duplicate . We recommend that you not interrupt the duplicate validation process. If you do, you will not be able to resume it; each time you click Process All , the processing starts anew for all listed records. You can validate individual records by manually executing the Check for Duplicates action, which is available in the Actions menu on the ([~/?ScreenId=CR301000|CR301000]) Leads, ([~/?ScreenId=CR302000|CR302000]) Contacts, and ([~/?ScreenId=CR303000|CR303000]) Business Accounts (CR303000) data entry forms, as described in Validating Records for Duplicates: To Validate Multiple Leads for Duplicates. Also, new records can be validated on entry if the corresponding settings have been specified on the Duplicate Validation Settings tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=CR101000|CR101000]) Customer Management Preferences (CR101000) form. In this case, validation scores are calculated for each new record on entry so that you do not have to manually run the gram recalculation process on the ([~/?ScreenId=CR503400|CR503400]) Calculate Grams (CR503400) form. If at least one possible duplicate has been found for a record, the Duplicates tab appears on the corresponding data entry form: ([~/?ScreenId=CR301000|CR301000]) Leads, ([~/?ScreenId=CR302000|CR302000]) Contacts, or ([~/?ScreenId=CR303000|CR303000]) Business Accounts. On this tab, you can merge duplicate records into one record or link records, as described in the following sections . Merging of Records on the Duplicates Tab When you have performed validation for duplicates (whether validation has been performed for a group of records or an individual record), you can merge duplicate records relative to the lead, contact, or business account selected on the data entry form on the Duplicates tab of the respective form as follows: On this tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=CR301000|CR301000]) Leads (CR301000) form, you can merge the target lead you select with the selected duplicate lead. Before merging leads, you should indicate to the system which settings to use: those of the target lead or those of the duplicate lead. On this tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=CR302000|CR302000]) Contacts (CR302000) form, you can merge the target contact you select with the selected duplicate contact. Before merging contacts, you should indicate to the system which settings to use: those of the target contact or those of the duplicate contact. On this tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=CR303000|CR303000]) Business Accounts (CR303000) form, you can merge the target business account you select with the selected duplicate business account. Before merging business accounts, you should indicate to the system which settings to use: those of the target business account or those of the duplicate account. The system does not allow merging of leads that are associated with different contacts: You cannot select such leads for merging. When you have resolved conflicts between the matching fields and merged the target record with the duplicate record, the duplicate record is no longer displayed on the Duplicates tab. For the duplicate record, the system inserts the Duplicated value in the Duplicate box of the ([~/?ScreenId=CR301000|CR301000]) Leads, ([~/?ScreenId=CR302000|CR302000]) Contacts, or ([~/?ScreenId=CR303000|CR303000]) Business Accounts form (Summary area) and closes this record as duplicate. Also, most of the settings in the Summary area of the form and the settings on the tabs of the form become unavailable for editing. For details, see Validating Records for Duplicates: To Validate a Lead for Duplicates. Linking of Records on the Duplicates Tab When you have performed validation for duplicates (whether validation has been performed for a group of records or an individual record), you can associate leads with contacts or business accounts, or contacts with leads and business accounts on the Duplicates tab of the respective form as follows: On this tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=CR301000|CR301000]) Leads (CR301000) form, you can associate the lead selected on the form with a contact or business account. When you associate the lead with a contact or business account by clicking Link to Entity on the table toolbar of the Duplicates tab, you can see the contact or business account in the Contact or Account box in the Summary area of the form. Before associating the selected lead with a contact or business account, you should indicate to the system which settings to use: those of the target lead or those of the contact or business account with which you are associating with the lead. On this tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=CR302000|CR302000]) Contacts (CR302000) form, you can associate the contact selected on the form with a lead or business account. When you associate the contact with a lead or business account by clicking Link to Entity , you can see the lead on the Leads tab of the form or the business account in the Account box in the Summary area of the form. Before associating the selected contact with a lead or business account, you should indicate to the system which settings to use: those of the target contact or those of the lead or business account with which you are associating with the contact. When you have associated a record with the lead, contact, or business account, this record is no longer displayed on the Duplicates tab. For details, see Validating Records for Duplicates: To Validate a Lead for Duplicates.

The following sections provide details you can use to ensure that the system is configured properly for validating lead, contact, and business account records for duplicates. This information will also help you understand (and change, if needed) the settings that affect the workflow of validating duplicate records. ==Implementation Checklist== We recommend that before you start validating records for duplicates, you make sure that the needed features have been enabled, settings have been specified, and entities have been created, as summarized in the following checklist.[anchor|#_75f5a845-9a95-409c-9ffd-7c022ec672dc] {| class="checklist" | width="100%" |- !width="42%" ! Before you start working with the lead in the system, you need to validate the lead for duplicates. ==Configuration Overview== For the purposes of this activity, the following tasks have been performed:[anchor|#_3bff7b7c-70ae-4527-8dc8-0248faca363d] *On the [HelpRoot_FormReference\CS_10_00_00|Enable/Disable Features] ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) form, the following features have been enabled: **''Customer Management'': Provides the customer relationship management (CRM) functionality, including lead and customer tracking. You have validated the ''Robert Watson'' lead for duplicates. On the '''Duplicates''' tab, you can see the duplicate lead and contact records. ==Step 2: Merging Duplicates== To merge two duplicate ''Robert Watson'' lead records, do the following:[anchor|#_6e303f8b-448e-471a-b51a-084dfe9d0bbe] #While you are still viewing the ''Robert Watson'' lead on the [HelpRoot_FormReference\CR_30_10_00|Leads] ([~/?ScreenId=CR301000|CR301000]) form, open the '''Duplicates''' tab. #On the tab, select the unlabeled check box for the possible duplicate lead ''Rob Watson'', which is displayed in the table. Notice that the '''Merge''' button has become available on the table toolbar. #:((({S:Hint}If the table lists more than one lead, you can select the unlabeled check boxes for all listed leads. Validating Records for Duplicates: To Validate a Lead for Duplicates Before you start working with a lead (or another employee does so), you may want to make sure that the lead has no duplicate leads in the system. The following activity will show you how to validate a lead for duplicates. The following activity is based on the U100 dataset. If you are using another dataset, or if any system settings have been changed in U100 , these changes can affect the workflow of the activity and the results of the processing. To avoid any issues, restore the U100 dataset to its initial state. Story Suppose that you are Bill Owen, a marketing manager of the SweetLife Fruits & Jams company. You have created a new lead, Robert Watson , the director of the supply chain at the Home Supplies store. Before you start working with the lead in the system, you need to validate the lead for duplicates. Configuration Overview For the purposes of this activity, the following tasks have been performed: On the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form, the following features have been enabled: Customer Management : Provides the customer relationship management (CRM) functionality, including lead and customer tracking. This feature also gives users the ability to manage sales opportunities, contacts, marketing lists, and campaigns . Lead/Contact Duplicate Validation in the Customer Management group of features: Provides the duplicate validation functionality. The Rob Watson leads has been created on the ([~/?ScreenId=CR301000|CR301000]) Leads (CR301000) form. The Rob Watson contact has been created on the ([~/?ScreenId=CR302000|CR302000]) Contacts (CR302000) form and associated with the Rob Watson lead . The Robert Watson leads has been created on the ([~/?ScreenId=CR301000|CR301000]) Leads (CR301000) form. Process Overview In this activit y, you will validate a lead for duplicates, merge the duplicate lead records into one record, and associate the lead record with the related contact record by using the ([~/?ScreenId=CR301000|CR301000]) Leads (CR301000) form. System Preparation Before you start validating a lead for duplicates, you should do the following: Launch the Acumatica ERP website, and sign in as a marketing manager by using the following credentials: Username: owen Password: 123 Make sure that on the Company and Branch Selection menu, in the top pane of the Acumatica ERP screen, the SweetLife Head Office and Wholesale Center branch is selected. Step 1: Validating a Lead for Duplicates To validate the Robert Watson lead for duplicates, do the following: Open the Leads (CR3010PL) form. In the row with Robert Watson in the Display Name column and Filled in an inquiry form on the company website in the Description column, click the Robert Watson link. The lead record opens on the ([~/?ScreenId=CR301000|CR301000]) Leads (CR301000) form. To search for a record in a list of records, you can enter a keyword or phrase in the Search box of the table toolbar. The system will find all the records that match your search criteria and display these records in the table. For details, see Searching in Acumatica ERP. On the form toolbar, click Actions Check for Duplicates . Because a possible duplicate has been found, the Duplicates tab appears on the form, and the system has inserted Possible Duplicate in the Duplicate box of the Summary area. You have validated the Robert Watson lead for duplicates. On the Duplicates tab, you can see the duplicate lead and contact records. Step 2: Merging Duplicates To merge two duplicate Robert Watson lead records, do the following: While you are still viewing the Robert Watson lead on the ([~/?ScreenId=CR301000|CR301000]) Leads (CR301000) form, open the Duplicates tab. On the tab, select the unlabeled check box for the possible duplicate lead Rob Watson , which is displayed in the table. Notice that the Merge button has become available on the table toolbar. If the table lists more than one lead, you can select the unlabeled check boxes for all listed leads. In the next instructions, you will be able to select among the needed settings of these duplicate leads for the target lead record . Click Merge . In the Target box of the dialog box that opens, the current lead is displayed. In the table below this box, you can see the list of duplicate values in the two records you are merging. In the Target box, you can click the magnifier icon to select the record that you want to keep as the dedicated record. In the lookup table that opens, you can see the list of duplicate leads. The duplicate lead Rob Watson has a different first name (which is not correct) and does not have a job title or a phone number, so your target lead is the one you should keep. While you are still working in the dialog box, do the following: In the row with Job Title in the Name column, select Director of Supply Chain . In the row with Phone 1 in the Name column, select 212-962-2362 . Click OK to merge the duplicate records and close the dialog box. In the Summary area, notice that the system has inserted Validated in the Duplicate box. The duplicate record that has been merged with the target one and has been removed from the Duplicates tab; the system has given the record the Disqualified status. Step 3: Linking Records on the Duplicates Tab To associate the Robert Watson lead with the Rob Watson contact and correct the settings in the contact record (the correct first name is Robert, not Rob), do the following: While you are still viewing the ([~/?ScreenId=CR301000|CR301000]) Leads (CR301000) form for the lead Robert Watson , open the Duplicates tab. In the row with Contact in the Type column and Robert Watson in the Display Name column, click the Robert Watson link to open the ([~/?ScreenId=CR302000|CR302000]) Contacts (CR302000) form in a pop-up window, and review the data in the contact record. Notice that the contact does not have a job title or any phone numbers. Close the ([~/?ScreenId=CR302000|CR302000]) Contacts form. On the table toolbar, click Link to Entity . In the Warning dialog box, which opens, click No , because you do not want to replace the contact information specified in the lead record with the information from the contact record; the information in the lead record is correct and has more details. The system closes the dialog box. In the Contact box of the Summary area, you can see the Robert Watson contact that the lead has been associated with. On the form toolbar, click Actions Check for Duplicates to make sure that no duplicate records for the Robert Watson lead have been found in the system. Notice that the system has inserted Validated in the Duplicate box. You have associated the lead with the contact.

Validating Records for Duplicates: To Validate Multiple Leads for Duplicates The following activity demonstrates how to validate records—such as leads, contacts, and business accounts—for duplicates. The following activity is based on the U100 dataset. If you are using another dataset, or if any system settings have been changed in U100 , these changes can affect the workflow of the activity and the results of the processing. To avoid any issues, restore the U100 dataset to its initial state. Story Suppose that you are Bill Owen, a marketing manager of the SweetLife Fruits & Jams company. You have imported to the system a new purchased list, which is in the PurchasedLeads.xlsx file and contains the contact information of bakery and restaurant employees. You need to check these leads for duplicates. Configuration Overview For the purposes of this activity, the following tasks have been performed: On the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form, the following features have been enabled: Customer Management : Provides the customer relationship management (CRM) functionality, including lead and customer tracking. This feature also gives users the ability to manage sales opportunities, contacts, marketing lists, and campaigns. Lead/Contact Duplicate Validation in the Customer Management group of features: Provides the duplicate validation functionality. Validation settings have been specified on the Duplicate Validation Settings tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=CR101000|CR101000]) Customer Management Preferences (CR101000) form. For details, see Duplicate Validation in . The PurchasedLeads.xlsx file, which contains a list of lead records that includes duplicates, has been imported to the system , which is done on the ([~/?ScreenId=SM206036|SM206036]) Import by Scenario (SM206036) form. Process Overview In this activity, you will do the following: Identify possible duplicates for newly imported lead records by using the ([~/?ScreenId=CR503410|CR503410]) Validate Leads and Contacts (CR503410) form. This form is available only if the Lead/Contact Duplicate Validation feature is enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form. In the U100 dataset, the feature is enabled. View possible duplicate lead records on the Duplicates tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=CR301000|CR301000]) Leads (CR301000) form. System Preparation Before you start validating records for duplicates, you should launch the Acumatica ERP website and sign in as a marketing manager by using the following credentials: Username: owen Password: 123 Step 1: Validating New Leads and Contacts for Duplicates To validate newly imported leads from the PurchasedLeads.xlsx file for duplicates, do the following: This procedure can also be applied to newly imported contacts. Open the ([~/?ScreenId=CR503410|CR503410]) Validate Leads and Contacts (CR503410) form. In the Summary area of the form, select the Validate New Records Only option button. On the form toolbar, click Process All to start the duplicate validation process. The Processing dialog box opens, showing the progress and, as soon as the processing has completed, the results of duplicate validation. If you want to identify all possible duplicate leads and contacts in the system (for example, to make your marketing data consistent and reliable), you should select the Validate All Records option button in the Summary area of the form. When the duplicate validation process has been completed, click Close to close the dialog box. Notice that the list of the records on the form no longer contains any records. You have validated newly imported leads for duplicates. On the ([~/?ScreenId=CR301000|CR301000]) Leads (CR301000) form, in the Duplicate column, the system has inserted the appropriate value for each lead: Validated or Possible Duplicate . Now you can view possible duplicate records, as described in the following step. Merging duplicates and linking the related leads and contacts is described in Validating Records for Duplicates: To Validate a Lead for Duplicates. Step 2: Viewing Possible Duplicate Records In the previous step, you have validated all leads in the system for duplicates. Now you need to view the list of leads that have possible duplicates and the Thomas Jones lead among these records. To view possible duplicates, do the following: While you are still viewing the ([~/?ScreenId=CR503410|CR503410]) Validate Leads and Contacts (CR503410) form, in the table, click the column header of the Duplicate column. In the Sorting and Filtering Settings dialog box, which opens, create a filter to view only records with the Possible Duplicate status as follows: Click Clear All . Select Possible Duplicate . Click OK . The table now lists only the records that have the Possible Duplicate status. Notice the Thomas Jones record, which has the Lead type in the Type column. Click the link in the Contact column in the row with the Thomas Jones record. The ([~/?ScreenId=CR301000|CR301000]) Leads (CR301000) form for the record opens in a pop-up window. On the ([~/?ScreenId=CR301000|CR301000]) Leads form, open the Duplicates tab. Now on the Duplicates tab, you can view the identical contact details of the duplicate records and merge duplicates or link related records, as described in Validating Records for Duplicates: To Validate a Lead for Duplicates.
